title: Synthetic Recap
body:
BOSTON — On a night where the Boston Garden faithful witnessed history, it was not the final score they will remember, but the singular, breathtaking performance of one man. Antoine Walker, in a virtuoso display of offensive firepower, poured in a career-high 42 points to will the Boston Celtics to a 94-84 victory over the Indiana Pacers.

From the opening tip, it was the Walker Show. He was unstoppable, a force of nature operating on a different plane. While the Pacers' Reggie Miller fought valiantly to keep pace with 27 points of his own, his effort was merely a compelling subplot to Walker’s masterpiece. The Celtics forward attacked from every conceivable angle, his 42 points standing as a monumental achievement against a stout Indiana defense.

The game was a defensive grind, with both teams struggling to find consistent scoring outside of their two stars. The Pacers’ Rik Smits added 15 points, but Boston’s supporting cast, led by Rick Fox’s 11 points, did just enough to provide a foundation for Walker’s heroics. The Celtics' defense ultimately clamped down, holding the Pacers to a paltry 84 points, but it was Walker’s historic output that defined the evening.

In the annals of Celtics lore, where the names of legends echo through the rafters, Antoine Walker carved his own chapter on this night. His 42-point explosion was more than just a win; it was a statement, a performance of such individual brilliance that it transcended the game itself and secured his place in the highlight reels of history.
